ghanaian.text: When a king has good counselors, his reign is peaceful.
If you educate a man you educate one individual, but if you educate a woman you educate a family.
So many little things makes a man love a woman in a big way.
The rabbit has a saying which goes: 'if you were born a male then you are given impossible tasks.'
When a child knows how to wash his hands well, he eats with the elders.
When a fool is told a proverb, it has to be explained to him.
When a yam doesn't grow well, we don't blame it; it is because of the soil.
'hit me but i must not hit you' is no game at all.
A tree that has grown bent for thirty years cannot be straightened in one year.
Although the horse is stupid, it does not follow that the rider is stupid.
At someone's funeral we weep for our own mothers and fathers.
If a man is unhappy, his conduct is the cause.
If everyone helps to hold up the sky, then one person does not become tired.
If someone hates you, don't let her find you hateful.
If there had been no poverty in europe, then the white man would not have come and spread his clothes in africa.
If they are uttering insults and don't mean you, and yet you reply, you have condemned yourself.
If you are merciful to the antelope, you go to bed hungry.
If you go to a rat's village and it is eating palm nuts, you eat some too.
If you have no time to take care of your sickness, you get time to die.
In order to find evildoers, every human being is given a name.
It is because of man we wear swords.
No matter how generous you are, you don't give your wife away.
No one roasts rotten meat and puts it in the mouth of their friend and then says 'you mouth stinks.'
Perhaps you will eat a whole elephant and nothing gets stuck in your throat, and then you eat a fish and a bone gets stuck in your throat.
The animal that is coming to be killed does not hear the hunter cough.
The one who is looking for a wife doesn't speak contemptuously of women.
The place where you are happy is better than the place you were born.
If you find no fish, you have to eat bread.
The blacksmith in one village becomes a blacksmith's apprentice in another.
You cannot hide behind your finger.
You cannot kill an elephant with bullets of wax.
You make a new arrow by comparing it to an old one.
He who is guilty has much to say.
He who seems to be for you may be working against you.
However high you lift the kid goat, you place it gently on the ground.
Hunger is felt by a slave and hunger is felt by a king.
I will get it because I can, one says with a reason.
If a woman gets rich she changes into a man.
If an opportunity is not taken when it comes, it passes away.
If God breaks your leg, He will teach you how to limp.
If power can be bought then sell your mother to get it.
If the building of a nest were easy, would the little "apatipers" bird roost in the fork of a tree?
Money is sharper than a sword.
Nature gave us two cheeks instead of one to make it easier to eat hot food.
No one boasts of what belongs to another.
No one tests the depth of the river with both feet.
Nobody is shamed twice.
One camel does not make fun of another camel's hump.
One cannot both feast and become rich.
One falsehood spoils a thousand truths.
One is born, one dies; the land increases.
One knows even when one neighbor's bread is in the oven.
The "obereku" bird should be eaten hot.
The army of the palm tree is its branches.
The blood soup made of one palm nut is shared in little drops.
The chicken also knows when it's morning, but still watches the mouth of the cock.
The family is like the forest: if you are outside, it is dense; if you are inside, you see that each tree has its own position.
The goat says: "Nobody willingly walks to his own death."
The goat says: "They bought my mother, not I."
The goat says: "What will come has already come."
The goat says: "Where there is blood, there is plenty of food."
The good wife at her husband's home, the other one is at her parent's home.
One lie ruins a thousand truths.
One palm nut cannot be peeled twice.
One should never rub bottoms with a porcupine.
One strong man does not catch another strong man.
Only the fool points at his origins with his left hand.
Only when you have crossed the river, can you say the crocodile has a lump on his snout.
People working on the slope of a mountain do not look at the buttocks of one another.
Rain beats on a leopard's skin, but it does not wash out the spots.
Rain wets a leopard's skin, but it does not wash out the spots.
Since the beggar would come any way, it's best to invite him first.
If you come near the river, you will hear the crab cough.
If you go too near your relatives, they will not respect you.
If you take your tongue to the pawnshop, you can't redeem it later.
If youthful pride were wealth, then every man would have had it in his lifetime.
It is easy to become a monk in one's old age.
It is Mr. Old-Man-Monkey who marries Mrs. Old-Woman-Monkey.
It is no shame at all to work for money.
It is not only one person who bathes in the witch's water.
It is not wrong to go back for that which you have forgotten.
It is only one bad palm tree that spoils the whole lot of palm wine.
It is the calm and silent water that drowns a man.
It is the fool whose own tomatoes are sold to him.
It is the fool's sheep that break loose twice.
It is the wife who knows her husband.
It's the fool's sheep that breaks loose twice.
Little palm tree, stop crying, you child is the tall palm tree.
Look to the past to help us move forward in the future.
Marriage is like a groundnut: you have to crack them to see what is inside.
Misfortune does not restrict his visits to one day.
If the goat says it will become a sheep, there will always be black spots on its body.
If the hunter comes back with mushrooms, don't ask him how his hunt was.
If the strong man has nothing else, he can at least command others.
If the young palm tree wants to stay alive, it grows next to the odum tree.
If there were no elephant in the jungle, the buffalo would be a great animal.
If things are getting easier, maybe you're headed downhill.
If two proverbs are not similar, one is not used to explain the other.
If two selfish young men sit next to a pot of water, the water spills out on the ground.
If we knew where death resided, we would never stay there.
If you are in hiding, don't light a fire.
Two small antelopes can beat one big one.
We must go back and reclaim our past so we can move forward; so we understand why and how we came to be who we are today.
What is bad luck for one man is good luck for another.
What people get by hard work they don't get for their neighbors.
When a deceiving man tells you to climb a tree, tell him to climb it first. If he finds a comfortable spot you can follow him.
When a king has good counsellors, his reign is peaceful.
When a man is coming toward you, you need not say, "Come here."
When a man is wealthy he may wear an old cloth.
When a man's coat is threadbare, it is easy to pick a hole in it.
When a woman is hungry, she says, "Roast something for the children that they may eat."
A woman is a flower in a garden; her husband is the fence around it.
A woman is like a blanket: If you cover yourself with it, it bothers you; if you throw it aside you will feel the cold.
A woman is like a rat: even if it grows up in your house, it steals from you.
A Worthy cause is worth pursuing to the end.
An army is driven back by courage and not by insults, however many.
By going and coming, a bird weaves its nest.
By the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed.
Death has the key to open the miser's chest.
Do not call the forest that shelters you a jungle.
Don't expect to be offered a chair when you visit a place where the chief himself sits on the floor.
The grasshopper which is always near its mother eats the best food.
The left hand washes the right and the right washes the left.
The monkey says there is nothing better than poverty to unlearn man of his conceit.
The moon moves slowly, but it gets across the town.
The poor man and the rich man do not play together.
The prickly branches of the palm tree do not show preference even to friends.
The rain wets the leopard's spots but does not wash them off.
The responsibility of power is like holding an egg. Grasp it too tightly and it will drip through your fingers; hold it too loosely and it will drop and break.
The rich man may wear old clothes.
The ruin of a nation begins in the homes of its people.
When someone is already approaching, there is no need to say "Come here."
When the bag tears, the shoulders get a rest.
When the cock is drunk, he forgets about the hawk.
When the palm nuts ripen, you carry half and I carry half.
When women increase in wealth, they are silent. But when they fall into trouble, the whole world gets to know.
When you are rich, you are resented; when you are poor, you are despised.
When you follow in the path of your father, you learn to walk like him.
Wisdom is not like money to be tied up and hidden.
Wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight.
You can always buy her back later.
The soul of a rich man has no taboos.
The strength of the palm tree is in its branches.
The surface of the water is beautiful, but it is no good to sleep on.
The white man lives in the castle; when he dies, he lies in the ground.
The witch is going! The witch is going! but if you are not a witch you don't turn around to look.
The witch kills "he ate and he did not give me", but she does not kill, "he gave me too little."
There is bound to be a knot in a very long string.
There is no distinction among the common baskets made of palm branches.
There is no medicine to cure hatred.
Times keep changing.
Even if the old woman has no teeth, her tiger nuts remain in her own bag.
Even the elephant can fan off flies with its short tail.
Even though the old man is strong and hearty, he will not live forever.
Even though the peel of the palm nut has no pulpy substance in it, it is stripped off all the same.
Even though the sound of the horn is not pleasant, it is still blown by a man's mouth.
Every one hates the red ant on a kola nut because he cannot eat or sell it.
Fire and gunpowder are not bedfellows.
Fire and gunpowder do not sleep together.
Hate has no medicine.
He who falls victim to his enemies can expect no mercy.
A calf that is sucking does not bellow.
A child does not laugh at the ugliness of his mother.
A child who is to be successful is not reared exclusively on a bed of down.
A crab does not beget a bird.
A cracked bell can never sound well.
A healthy person who begs for food is an insult to a generous farmer.
A knife does not know who is its master.
Who follows the elephant will have no problems.
A powerful deity is the one to whom sacrifices are offered.
A slave does not choose his master.
A stranger dances - he does not sing.
There is no medicine against old age.
Money is like the waters of a swelling river, it flows away.
If it is dark, all men are black.
If someone is walking towards you, you don’t need to tell him "come here."
If the elders leave you a legacy of dignified language, you do not abandon it and speak childish language.
If we put a hammer in every person’s hand, could they all become blacksmiths?
If your sister is in the group of singing girls, you name always comes into the song.
It is no disgrace at all to work for money.
Nobody hates anybody without cause.
Numbers can achieve anything.
One camel does not make fun of the other camel’s hump.
One head alone does not go into council.
One lie spoils a thousand truths.
The brother or sister who does not respect the traditions of the elders will not be allowed to eat with the elders.
The elders of the village are the boundaries.
Those who are born on top of the anthill take a short time to grow tall.
When a fish rots, the head stinks first.
When you are rich, you are hated; when you are poor, you are despised.
Where error gets to, correction cannot reach.
You don’t need a light to see someone you know intimately at night.
An army of sheep led by a lion can defeat an army of lions led by a sheep.
Marriage is like a groundnut; you have to crack it to see what is inside.
So many little things makes a man love a woman in a BIG way.
The goat says: Where there is blood, there is plenty of food.
A good word removes anger.
All heads are the same, but not all thoughts are the same.
Bad luck for one man is good luck for another.
By coming and going, a bird constructs its nest.
Those who want rain must also accept the mud.
Do not beat a drum with an axe.
One head does not contain all the wisdom.
Money is not the medicine against death.
If ten cents does not go out, it does not bring in one thousand dollars.
You become wise when you begin to run out of money.
You should not hoard your money and die of hunger.
Love doesn’t listen to rumors.
Don’t expect to be offered a chair when you are visiting a place where the chief sits on the floor.
Even the lion, the king of the forest, protects himself against flies.
Gunpowder and fire do not agree.
Only a fool tests the water’s depth with both feet.
Several repeated visits to the mud pit enable the wasp to build its house.
If a blind man says he will throw a stone at you, he probably has his foot on one.
A man dies but his tongue does not rot.
If you are honored, honor yourself.
If your child is dancing clumsily, tell him: 'you are dancing clumsily'; do not tell him: 'darling, do as you please.'
If your part of the battlefield is covered with thorns, you do not leave your position and go to stand where the ground is good.
Ingratitude is sooner or later fatal to its author.
People are the thing: if i call 'gold,' gold does not respond; if i call 'clothes,' clothes do not respond; people are the thing.
You must eat an elephant one bite at a time.
Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
The old woman looks after the child to grow its teeth and the young one in turn looks after the old woman when she loses her teeth.
The puff adder that cannot fly has caught the hornbill that flies.
The tsetse-fly is perched on the tortoise's back in vain.
There is nothing wrong with learning from hindsight.
When a shield wears out, the framework still remains.
When the hen steps on the feet of her chicken, she does not mean to kill them.
When you go to a town and you see the chief of the town is in handcuffs, you do not ask whether everything is alright in that town.
You are the subject of he whose handcuffs you wear.
You do not need a big stick to break a cock's head.
Only birds of the same clan or species play together on the same tree.
The child is capable of splitting open the snail, not the tortoise.
The clever bird is easily trapped in the leaves at the edges.
The crocodile does not die under the water so that we can call the monkey to celebrate its funeral.
The good mother knows what her children will eat.
The gun catridge-belt of Akowua has never been known to lack bullets.
The knot tied by a wiseman cannot be undone by a fool.
The one who asks questions doesn't lose his way.
A child who is to be successful is not to be reared exclusively on a bed of down.
Although the snake does not fly, it has caught the hornbill, whose home is in the sky.
Death's ladder is there for everyone to climb.
Fowls will not spare a cockroach that falls in their midst.
If a horn deserves a jawbone, they attach one to it.
If all the seeds that fall were to grow, then no one could follow the path under the trees.
If an ass goes a-traveling, he'll not come home a horse.
A bird flies high above and its funeral is performed on the ground.
An eye is small but its usefulness is great.
Also the black cow produces white milk.
An empty sack cannot stand.
Bad water also quenches the fire.
If patience hides something, anger won't search and get.
Impatience with your brother is in the flesh, it doesn't reach the bone.
If you do not have sandals, find some, if you do not have gun powder, find some for a score to settle with you on the battle grounds.
It is a fool whose own tomatoes are sold to him.
Only a wise person can solve a difficult problem.
Dogs do not actually prefer bones to meat; it is just that no one ever gives them meat.
The tongue kills a man and the tongue saves a man.
If you are in hiding, don’t light a fire.
Don’t expect to be offered a chair when you visit a place where the chief himself sits on the floor.
One camel does not make fun of another camel’s hump.
The rain wets the leopard’s spots but does not wash them off.
It is Mr. Old-Man-Monkey who marries Mrs.Old-Woman-Monkey.
Hunger is felt by slave and king alike.
If the hunter comes back with mushrooms, don’t ask him how his hunt was.
The chicken also knows when it’s morning, but still watches the mouth of the cock.
Death has the key to open the miser’s chest.
Loving someone who does not love you is like loving the rain that falls in the forest.
Rain wets a leopard’s skin, but it does not wash out the spots.
When a bachelor goes to sleep, he does not hide his entire body in the mosquito net.
He who tests the depth of a stream with both feet must be prepared to swim.
The wealth of the greedy ultimately goes to the community.
If all seeds that fall were to grow, then no one could follow the path under the trees.
A poor person has no friends.
When the fool is told a proverb, its meaning has to be explained to him.
Monkeys play by sizes.
Even though the eye is blind, it still contains sleep.
No one tests the depth of a river with both feet.
What the cat sees and turns its eyes away from, the dog sees and barks at.
If one does not know, another man teaches him.
The parrot that knows how precious its feathers are does not build its nest by the roadside.
It is the fool’s sheep that break loose twice.
I call gold; it does not answer. I call cloth; it does not answer. It is the human being that counts.
If you want someone more knowledgeable than yourself to identify a bird you do not first remove the feathers.
No-one points his left finger at his hometown.
Although the snake does not fly it catches the bird whose home is in the sky.
A child who knows how to wash his hands dines with the elders.
Whatever is destined to succeed knows no failure.
When a woman is hungry, she says: "Roast something for the children that they may eat.
Don’t cry over spilt milk.
Only when you have crossed the river can you say the crocodile has a lump on his snout.
It is a bad child who does not take advice.
No one points out God to a child.
It is not everybody who is awake when the rain falls at night.
The bitter heart eats its owner.
Let not what you cannot do tear you from what you can do.
If you do not spare a day to fix a door to your room, you will waste three years searching for your money but you will never find it.
If you take your tongue to the pawnshop, you can’t redeem it later.
The monkey says that yawning is contagious.
If it is not the will of God, you will not die.
A proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride.
A man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his own greatness.
ghanaian.description: What goes around, comes around so whatever you sow, you shall reap.

ghanaian.text: The poor man’s main tool is his tongue with which he defends himself.
The antelope says that if you stay at one spot in the forest for far too long, you will become thirsty.
One tree cannot be a forest.
Even though we carry gunpowder on our head, we still smoke a pipe.
We speak to the wise man in proverbs and not in plain language.
He who cannot dance will say: "The drum is bad.
No condition is permanent.
If a mad man snatches your cover cloth from you, you do not follow him naked to retrieve it.
One pole cannot build a house.
Truth is a cure.
When I fall and you fall, it is fair play.
Only someone else can scratch your back for you.
When a man is coming toward you, you need not say: "Come here.
The child who has not traveled anywhere before believes that his mother is the best cook.
In a community of beggars, stealing and not begging, is considered a crime.
A family is like a forest, when you are outside it is dense. When you are inside you see that each tree has its own position to occupy.
You must act as if it is impossible to fail.
If you blame the cat, you must blame the mouse as well.
If you are on the road to nowhere, find another road.
The old woman cares for the chicken and the chicken cares for the old woman.
When you are sitting in your own house, you don’t learn anything. You must get out of your house to learn.
If you store saliva in your mouth for too long, it turns into water.
One finger cannot pick a stone.
The cockerel drinking water raises its head to God in thankfulness.
A person who rides a bicycle or horse does not know that the ground is hot.
Much roaming about deprived the male rat of its fat.
A lizard that knows how to hide grows to become a crocodile.
If things are getting easier, maybe you’re headed downhill.
The orphan does not rejoice after a heavy breakfast.
Yam is sweet, but one should eat it in the normal way, lest swallowing chokes him.
Patience is good, but hard to practice.
Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.
ghanaian.description: Don’t look at your mistakes; look at what caused your mistakes, otherwise you may repeat the same mistake again.

ghanaian.text: Looking somewhere is better than not to look anywhere at all.
If you’ve not been on someone else’s farm, you cannot say that you’re the only true farmer.
It’s the fool’s sheep that breaks loose twice.
It is when someone loves you that he comes to your house.
A child who asks questions does not become a fool.
Do not follow the path. Go where there is no path to begin a trail.
In the presence of the head, the knee does not wear a hat.
The stomach has no holiday.
If you want to speak to God, tell it to the wind.
If you look at a king’s mouth, you will never think that he ever sucked his mother’s breast.
